programme.title: Como Dice el Dicho

programme.sub-title: Kilwa Kisiwani: The Swahili King of the Indian Ocean
programme.desc: This ancient ruined city, lost to history, was one of the most powerful in the world during its prime. The architectural sophistication and sheer size will amaze. Then Journeys heads out to the deep ocean for some big game fishing. Will we land the big one or return empty handed?

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: Featured in films and documentaries, the mane-less lions of Tsavo have a fierce reputation – man-eaters. Journeys embarks on a photo hunt for these legendary beasts of the bush. In the process, we witness the raw power of the ghosts in the dark.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.sub-title: Mombasa: The Center of it All
programme.desc: Gold, ivory and slaves drove the economy of the East coast of Africa 500 years ago. Join us as we explore the Portuguese and Arab roles in these horrific trade schemes. We'll also investigate the pristine waters off the coast of the nearby National Park where our host dons a snorkel mask and comes face-to-face with the creatures of the coral reef.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.sub-title: Arusha/Manyara: Hidden Wonders of the North
programme.desc: The Great Rift Valley is actually where the continent of Africa is literally tearing itself apart. It's a geologic phenomenon where one side is a rainforest full of colorful birds and strange monkeys and the other, a large lake centered on a vast plain. Two bordering eco-zones…double the wildlife.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.sub-title: Great Cities of Tanzania: Countdown to History
programme.desc: To this day sisal, a rope making fiber plant, is a mainstay of the economy. Journeys tours the capital city of Tanzania and its diverse religious institutions before heading into sisal country. We'll learn about the German influences and the seldom heard story of Livingstone's final trip across Africa.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.sub-title: Saadani National Park: The History The Land and The Sea
programme.desc: This is one of the few national parks in Africa where the bush meets the ocean. The big game of Africa face off with the creatures of the deep. Our host goes a little rogue for supper and tries his hand at surf netting prawns after spending a day looking for the elusive elephants of Saadani.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.sub-title: Mikumi National Park: Gateway to the Southern Circuit
programme.desc: If there ever was a lost wildlife gem, it would be Mikumi. Here many of the Big Twelve live their lives against the backdrop of one of the most scenic parks in Africa. Bill takes a break from the wildlife safari to investigate the huge salt works at the edge of the park and how it may impact future conservation.

programme.title: Treyvaud Travels
programme.desc: Treyvaud travels to meet master smoker Paul Curry, later cooking a great dish while gaining exclusive access to one of Irelands most stunning private castles. Then its off to Corick House Hotel & Spa for a spot of foraging and more great recipes!

programme.title: Treyvaud Travels
programme.desc: Treyvaud travels to Long Meadow Cider company to see how father and son team Pat & Peter make their incredible cider. Then we step back in time to see how the Celts cooked over 2,000 years ago in The Navan Centre in County Armagh.

programme.title: Treyvaud Travels
programme.desc: Treyvaud travels to the town of Kenmare to see how to smoke the world famous Star Seafood Smoked salmon, then cooks an incredible dish in an original famine Cottage in the stunning Gleninchaquin Park.

programme.title: Treyvaud Travels
programme.desc: Treyvaud travels to Killarney and cooks a healthy dish on a jaunting car whilst being whisked through the stunning national Park. Then hikes up Cardiac Hill before having a pint in The Killarney Brewing Company.

programme.title: Treyvaud Travels
programme.desc: Treyvaud travels to Quinns pub in Dungannon to look back at his entire series. We get to see hilarious unseen footage, bloopers and some of Treyvaud's most favorite moments of his amazing travels.

programme.title: Treyvaud's Kitchen
programme.desc: Paul cooks four great recipes, Carpaccio of Fresh Kenmare Bay Scallops, Spatchcocked sweet chilli Chicken with warm wraps, Pan fried quail with chargrilled baby gem lettuce and A White Chocolate Risotto. Paul shows you how to remove the entire ribcage of the chicken and also how to perfectly butcher a quail.

programme.title: A Taste of History
programme.desc: Boston is the site of so many important events that led up to the American Revolution, including the Boston Massacre, the Boston Tea Party, and the oldest existing American war ship, the USS Constitution. Visitors today can follow the Freedom Trail in downtown Boston on a walking tour through American history.

programme.title: A Taste of History
programme.desc: Everyone knows of Henry Longfellow's poem, “The Midnight Ride of Paul Revere.” The poem made an obscure silversmith into an enduring Revolutionary legend, but how much do we actually know of the events that took place at Old North Church and at the Battle of Lexington. In this episode, historian Dr. William Fowler brings the famous poem to life, and we also visit Paul Revere's house.

programme.title: A Taste of History
programme.desc: John Adams, 2nd President, is arguably one of our most important founding fathers, but he feared history would not remember him. In this episode, we visit Adams' birthplace home in Quincy, MA, and we bring Adams back to life in Independence Hall, to experience why he was so important to America's birth.

programme.title: A Taste of History
programme.desc: In the second half of the 18th Century, the island of Antigua in the West Indies played a critical role in British Naval supremacy. It was the second largest British port, after London, and was run by none other than Lord Admiral Nelson. We visit Antigua to see what life was like for British sailors, and we cook at the oldest Sugar Plantation in Antigua, Betty's Hope.

programme.title: A Taste of History
programme.desc: St. Lucia played a critical role in winning the American Revolution, when the British stationed in St. Lucia missed seeing French ships leave Martinique, headed for Yorktown, VA. We visit St. Lucia, and discover an island with a magical mixture of Indian, African, French and British cultures, and explore the rainforests where cacao, bananas and other tropical delights grow.

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here!
programme.desc: Food-obsessed funnyman John Catucci travels across Canada on a journey to find the country's best comfort foods. At each stop, Catucci dives into the kitchens of local restaurants to help cook their signature dishes. He also meets the owners, chefs and patrons who make each restaurant a destination that people want to frequent, learning about their family traditions and their passion for good food. Among the culinary adventures on Catucci's journey are sampling more than 40 gourmet burgers in London, Ontario, and braving a chef's preference mystery meal in Victoria, British Columbia.

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.desc: English chef, restaurateur and TV personality Jamie Oliver teaches viewers how to cook a meal in just 15 minutes. During each episode, Oliver prepares two meals, each taking 15 minutes. The chef aims to provide simple yet delicious recipes that have been tested by cooks of all standards to be sure it can be done in just a quarter of an hour. Oliver also provides timesaving kitchen shortcuts using basic kitchen appliances that cut down on prep time. Inspired by tastes from all over the world, Oliver creates superfast dishes with a balance of flavor and nutrition.

programme.title: Should Have Seen This Coming
programme.desc: First, Lou, Sonia, and Froy unfurl an elaborate sting when they repo a taxicab by tricking its driver into picking them up. But what to do with his ferociously inebriated client?

programme.title: Vampires and Drunks
programme.desc: First, Froy and Sonia take a trip to Beverly Hills to interrupt the salon appointment of a wealthy trophy wife who isn't going to let her prized possession go without a fight. Then, Sonia and Matt use the cover of night to sneak away a Nissan. Too bad the owner is throwing a party with his neck-biting, vampire-wannabe friends. And finally, Matt and Froy face the fury of a clan of drunken relatives when they interrupt a raucous family reunion.

programme.title: I Don't Know What That Is
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy crash a raucous brew-fest to sneak an ATV away from a crowd of tipsy revelers. Then, Matt and Lou come face-to-face with a fraternity prank gone awry - these college kids have a sledgehammer, and they're not afraid to use it. And finally, Lou, Lyndah, and Sonia take on the task of repossessing a Corolla from a woman with a bun in the oven and an axe to grind.

programme.title: Incompetent and Unfaithful
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy slip into a gated community for a repossession only to attract the attention of a trio of irate and incompetent security guards. Then, Lou and Sonia come face-to-face with a debtor and her entire adult-league championship softball team. And finally, Froy and Sonia stumble into a bizarre love triangle when it turns out their car is owned by the sugar-daddy of a cheating spouse.

programme.title: Don't Cry, Bro
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy track a car to the compound of what seems to be a polygamist cult. Will their charismatic leader put up a fight for his Prius, or will he have his followers do it for him?

programme.title: Don't Spray Me with That
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy repossess an experimental concept motorcycle from a hose-wielding yuppie. Then, Froy and Sonia head to a casting agency to repossess a car from a two-faced receptionist with a special talent for four-letter words. And finally, Froy and Matt get way more than they bargained for when they try to repossess a van from an exterminator who is not afraid to unload his bug-killing spray on humans.

programme.title: There Was an Accident
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy head to a supermarket to repossess a Mitsubishi from a truant bagboy, but they'll also have to contend with a furious shopper. Then, Matt and Froy find their car, but it's been heavily vandalized and has what looks to be the victim of an attack lying across its front seat. And finally, Lou and Matt have some trouble reclaiming a Ford when its owner starts coming at them with illegal military hardware.

programme.title: Go Kart Them Away
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy repossess a car from a cheating husband who's shacked up at a nearby motel. His wife probably isn't going to be too happy to hear about this. Then, Sonia and Lyndah crash a high school reunion to confront an over-the-hill jock and his pack of angry cougar cheerleaders. And finally, Lyndah reveals her plot for the whole team to work together and repossess an entire truckload of souped-up go karts.

programme.title: Yoga-to Be Kidding Me
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy head into a nice part of town to repossess a BMW from an entitled yuppie, but first they'll have to contend with his rampaging long-distance girlfriend. Then, Lou, Lyndah, and Matt venture into a trailer park where they find a debtor who's as angry as he is drunk. And finally, Sonia and Lyndah travel under the cover of night to repossess a vehicle from a young woman and her irate yoga instructor.

programme.title: Repo, the Final Frontier
programme.desc: First, Froy and Sonia trace an out-of-state skip account to a seedy motel, where they come face-to-face with a hopping-mad cowboy and his female companion. Then, Matt and Sonia go where no repo man has gone before to repossess a Ford from a delusional nerd who may as well actually be from space. And finally, Lou and Lyndah have trouble getting to their car because there's a chainsaw-wielding gardener in the way.

programme.title: Coffee-slinging Waitress
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy storm a studio to repossess a Corvette from a surly European photographer and his hapless, bikini-clad subjects. Then, Lou and Matt stumble into a lover's quarrel - will they be able to reclaim the vehicle from two suited suitors? And finally, Lyndah and Sonia wind up getting burned on a repo, literally, when a coffee-wielding waitress goes buck-wild.

programme.title: Matt Vs. Sonia
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy respond to a tip from an informant and wind up in the middle of an epic story of intrigue, betrayal, and drunk girls fighting each other. Then, a high-class croquet party gets interrupted when Matt and Lou come through to repossess a Volkswagen And finally, it's a trip to a parking garage to repossess a stolen limo - with a gaggle of partiers in the back. Will Matt and Sonia be able to hook and book, or will they wind up at each others' throats?

programme.title: It's Not Funny
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy interrupt a comedian's preparations for a show to repossess his Dodge, but not if his girlfriend has anything to say about it. Then, Lyndah & Sonia respond to a tip and sabotage a paparazzo's big shot by hooking his car. And finally, Lou and Matt have to take a van from an amateur marching band with a terrible secret.

programme.title: A Zamboni?
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy interrupt a debtor's tattooing session to reclaim his vehicle. Then, Sonia and Lyndah find themselves in an uncomfortable situation when they barge in on a couple engaging in some risqué role-playing. And finally, Lou & Matt hit the ice and a bunch of irate hockey players in an effort to repossess a Zamboni
